title: OgNasty
author: OgNasty
content: https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1646564065853194241Elon just tweeted that: “For the next 12 months, Twitter will keep none of the money. You will receive whatever money we receive, so that’s 70% for subscriptions on iOS & Android (they charge 30%) and ~92% on web (could be better, depending on payment processor).After first year, iOS & Android fees drop to 15% and we will add a small amount on top of that, depending on volume.We will also help promote your work. Our goal is to maximize creator prosperity. At any point, you can leave our platform and take your work with you. Easy in, easy out.”This is a pretty awesome move to get good content on the platform. Seemingly a direct shot at YouTube. Will you be offering subscriptions to your followers? You need to be 18+, tweet a lot, & have 500 followers… I’ve never really cared about follower count, but it would be cool to participate in this program and start making some cool content. Feel free to post your twitter handle if you are planning to create subscription content. Mine is @NastyMining

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: This is a pretty good move by the new Twitter management to monetize content creations in the platform will be a cool addition to content creators. Content creation has been one of the few areas I want to dive into but has been finding it tough with YouTube nobs now that Twitter is offering it out afresh I will be glad to be among the first to take advantage especially now that I have tons of active followers on Twitter. @OgNasty I kind of wonder if you offer mentorship service in content creation it looks like you have advanced knowledge on that please let me know to possibly enrol on your mentorship class.

The only content I create currently is with my drone and it’s been a while since I’ve done a new video. I’m a content creation newbie as far as anyone should be concerned, but thought it might be fun to give Elon a couple bucks and create some content for the platform to see how it goes compared with platforms like YouTube. I would feel like a scammer offering a mentorship in this area because I am far from an expert. There are only a few areas I’d feel comfortable acting as a mentor and the only one I’d share publicly is that I feel I have knowledge on budgeting, investing, and managing your finances responsibly to be able to enjoy early retirement that would be beneficial to most people.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Wiwo on April 13, 2023, 11:01:52 PMThis is a pretty good move by the new Twitter management to monetize content creations in the platform will be a cool addition to content creators. Content creation has been one of the few areas I want to dive into but has been finding it tough with YouTube nobs now that Twitter is offering it out afresh I will be glad to be among the first to take advantage especially now that I have tons of active followers on Twitter. This move by Elon Musk is a smart marketing strategy to attract more content creators to Twitter. It will make content creators put in their best to get the required number of followers and start making money. One of the problems of this kind of enticing policy is inconsistency. Twitter might decide to change this partnership policy in the future and replace it with unfavorable clauses. Content creation is an interesting area to engage in but it requires time and money to produce quality content. You don't need to be a professional to start creating content because you will learn on the job and your quality will keep improving as you become consistent. It is an area I will like to exploit if I become financially stable and when my children are grown up.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: I am not a content creator on YouTube or other social media, but the steps taken by Elon Musk are brilliant steps and he understands very well that in the business world if you want to compete with platforms that are already stable, you must provide something different and that difference must be a big and real difference can be felt by people so that in the end they will move or at least use both platforms simultaneously because they can increase their income by using two social media in their creations. It can be seen that paid Twitter users are benefiting even though in business the winner is actually himself.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: This is another hint that Elon musk is not in a hurry to recover all that money he gave for Twitter. Of course, I cannot argue against creators getting some of money so they can continue to develop their talent. It is a good first step. I personally have friends on Twitter who unfortunateky have suffered from being shadow banned, so their content cannot be seen as much as they would like.  Waiting for Elon to revoke shadowbanning, since it goes directly against he wants Twitter to be.
